articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz Launch Campaign in Battleground States
articles.description: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her vice presidential pick, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, kicked off their joint campaign in Philadelphia. Walz shared his background and criticized Trump, emphasizing reproductive rights and other progressive issues. The campaign aims to introduce Walz and sway key battleground states.
articles.content: Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris and her newly-selected vice presidential running mate, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, campaigned together for the first time on Tuesday in Philadelphia. The rally is the start of a multi-day tour of battleg... [702 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz Certified as Democratic Nominees for 2024
articles.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz have been officially certified as the Democratic Party's nominees for President and Vice President respectively. This comes after delegate voting and final certification by the Convention Secretary. A new poll shows Harris leading former President Trump by three points.
articles.content:
US Vice President Kamala Harris and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz have officially been certified as the Democratic Party's nominees for President and Vice President respectively, the ruling party announced on Tuesday.

articles.title: AOC paints Left and Walz as ‘normal’ compared to ‘weird’ Trump-Vance ticket
articles.description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) labeled Democrats and Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) as "normal," in contrast to the "creepy" Republican ticket.
articles.content:
Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) marketed progressive Democrats and Gov. Tim Walz (D-MN) as “normal” in contrast to the “creepy” ticket of former President Donald Trump and Sen. J.D. Vance (R-OH).

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Threats Against Trudeau: Ontario Man Charged
articles.description: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police have charged a 33-year-old Ontario man with making violent threats against Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. This charge follows the arrest of two Alberta men for similar threats last month. Increased security measures have been in place since an assassination attempt on U.S. candidate Donald Trump.
articles.content:
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police announced they have charged a 33-year-old man from Ontario with making violent threats against Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. This development comes just weeks after two Alberta men faced similar charges.

articles.title: The 'Trump trade' is fading
articles.description: Less than a month ago, traders were staring to place bets on a Trump presidential win, including a GOP sweep of Congress. Those bets are now off.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: FBI Seizes Rep. Andy Ogles' Cell Phone Amid Campaign Fund Probe
articles.description: FBI agents have seized the cell phone of Republican Representative Andy Ogles as part of an investigation into issues surrounding his campaign fund disclosures. Ogles confirmed the seizure, acknowledged past mistakes in financial filings, and pledged cooperation with law enforcement. Ogles, endorsed by Donald Trump, recently called for Vice President Kamala Harris's impeachment.
articles.content:
FBI agents have seized Republican Representative Andy Ogles' cell phone as part of an investigation into problems surrounding his campaign fund disclosures, the freshman lawmaker revealed on Tuesday.

articles.content:

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Arizona Grand Jury's Attempt to Indict Trump Over Election Scheme
articles.description: An Arizona grand jury, which charged 18 individuals in a plot to overturn the 2020 presidential election results, also aimed to indict former President Donald Trump. However, prosecutors advised against charging Trump, referencing a Justice Department policy discouraging state and federal cases against the same defendant based on similar facts.
articles.content:
An Arizona grand jury that charged 18 people this spring in a scheme aiming to overturn former President Donald Trump's 2020 election defeat also intended to indict him, according to court papers cited by the New York Times on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz Kick Off Swing State Campaign Tour
articles.description: Vice President Kamala Harris and Minnesota Governor Tim Walz will launch their presidential campaign with a rally in Philadelphia, targeting critical swing states. Walz, a seasoned politician with a progressive agenda, was selected for his ability to attract rural voters. Trump and his running mate JD Vance criticized the new Democratic duo.

articles.title: Pakistani Man Charged in US Assassination Plot Tied to Iran
articles.description: A Pakistani man, Asif Merchant, has been charged in Brooklyn for allegedly plotting political assassinations in the US with ties to Iran. The plot was foiled before execution. The case coincides with heightened security for former President Trump after a separate unrelated threat. US officials are vigilant against Iran's vendetta for Qassem Soleimani's killing.
articles.content:
A Pakistani man alleged to have ties to Iran has been charged in a plot to carry out political assassinations on US soil, the Justice Department said on Tuesday.
